org.cip4.elk.alces.transport
Class HttpReceiver

java.lang.Object
  org.cip4.elk.alces.transport.HttpReceiver

public class HttpReceiver
extends java.lang.Object

A service for receiving JMF messages over HTTP, essentially a HTTP server.

Author:
Claes Buckwalter (clabu@itn.liu.se)

Constructor Summary
HttpReceiver(TestSuite testSuite)
          Creates a new HttpReceiver.
 
Method Summary
 boolean isStarted()
          Returns true if the service is started.
 void startServer(int port)
          Starts a server that listens to requests at: http://127.0.0.1:port/alces/jmf
 void startServer(java.lang.String host, int port)
          Starts a server that listens for requests at: http://host:port/alces/jmf
 void startServer(java.lang.String host, int port, java.lang.String jmfContextPath, java.lang.String resourceBase)
          Starts a HTTP server that publishes static files, such as JDF and resource files, to http://host:port/ and listens for JMF requests on http://host:port/contextPath.
 void stopServer()
          Stops the HTTP server.

Constructor Detail

HttpReceiver

public HttpReceiver(TestSuite testSuite)
Creates a new HttpReceiver. Received messages are added to the looked the specified TestSuite.

Parameters:
testSuite - the TestSuite to add received messages to

                 throws java.lang.Exception

                        int port)

Parameters:

startServer

public void startServer(java.lang.String host,
                        int port,
                        java.lang.String jmfContextPath,
                        java.lang.String resourceBase)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
Starts a HTTP server that publishes static files, such as JDF and resource files, to http://host:port/ and listens for JMF requests on http://host:port/contextPath.

Parameters:
host - server hostname
port - server port
jmfContextPath - server context path where server listens for JMF messages
resourceBase - path in local filesystem to the root folder of the static files that will be published be the server
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if the HTTP server could not by started

isStarted

public boolean isStarted()
Returns true if the service is started.

Returns:
true if the service is started; false otherwise

stopServer

public void stopServer()
                throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Stops the HTTP server.

Throws:
InterruptedExceptions
java.lang.InterruptedException
